content.description: This is the next crack, right of "Get Up, Stand Up".
content.protection:
Pro to 1".

Two-bolt anchor at top.

content.description: This is the thin crack to the right of "Welcome to the Iris Slab".
content.protection:
Pro to 1.5".

Two-bolt top anchor say like ten feet / three meters down from the top of cliff (but above where it gets sustained steeper below).

I think this anchor is shared with "Groovin".

For setting up Top-Rope, perhaps could rappel in (with some diagonal) from the top anchor for "Welcome to the Iris Slab".

content.description: This route is around the corner from main wall (to the right). First climb boulder problem to the ledge and then continue via face and thin crack to the top.
content.protection: Gear anchor at the top, adding directional is helpful.

content.description:
The climb begins on the right most portion of the large ledge.

Follow the broken crack line up the face to an improbable right leaning edge go for the undercling and pull over the lip, seems much harder than 5.8 when first faced with the move at the top. I really like this route definitely not straightforward, a little tricky at the end.

Oh yeah and if you feel inspired to lead this climb don't do it unless you want to solo it....
content.protection:
Pro to 1".

Two-bolt top anchor say like ten feet / three meters down from the top of cliff (but above where it gets sustained steeper below).

I think this anchor is shared with "Sting".

content.description:
This is the thin crack to the right of "Exodus".

A thought provoking move is encountered at about 3/4 height.
content.protection: pro to 1" or top rope. Bolts on top.

content.description: Climb the face, right of "Crazy Bald Head".
content.protection:
Pro to 1" or top rope.

Anchor at at top with two bolts, with two chains attached for rappel.

content.description:
Climb the crack to the right of "Concrete Jungle", to a horizontal. Move right to a crack to the top.

Variation: At the horizontal, move left and follow a crack.
content.protection: Standard rack or top rope. Bolt anchors.

content.description: Climb the face to the right of "Easy Skankin'". I couldn't find any 5.10c on this route.
content.protection:
Pro to 1".

Two bolt anchor at top.

content.description: On the left side of the rock, climb twin cracks, some 5.7 moves pass a seam to more crack climbing.
content.protection:
Standard gear or top rope.

Two-bolt anchor at top.
